Title: Reappointment

Title: News Clarification
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that in continuation reply to the news clarification dated August 14, 2013 Bank has further clarified that "The Bank had sactioned term loans for buying out the Retail Loan Portfolio to various Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs). Some of the said NBFCs had availed the term load in different tranches and some are yet to avail the same. Portfolio Buy out/Securitization of Assets is a normal Banking transaction being followed by many Banks to increase their assets as permitted by RBI. Hence, we once again reiterate that the above is the normal course of business being done by the Bank". Read Less

Title: News Verification
Summary: News Verification : The media had reports that Canara Bank is in talks with Capital First and other NBFCs to buy their retail loan portfolio . The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. Canara Bank has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "In terms of Monetary Policy Statement 2012-13 announced on April 17, 2012, the Reserve Bank of India had issued final revised guidelines on Securitization vide DBOD No. BP.BC-103/21.04.177/2011-12, dated 07-05-2012. These guidelines on securitization are applicable to Banks (excluding RRBs and Local Area Banks) and All India Term Lending and Refinancing Institution viz., Exim Bank, NABARD, NHB and SIDBI. The Policy Statement cover guidelines involving transfer of assets through Securitization and Direct Assignment of Cash Flows only and will be on without recourse basis. Accordingly, based on these guidelines, on obtaining the approval of the Board, the said policy has been put in place by the Bank. To begin with, the said policy has been implemented in Bangalore, Chennai, Delhi, Mumbai and Pune and from the Prime Corporate Branches / Extra-Large Branches designated by the Circle Offices situated in the said areas by approaching various Non-Banking Financial Services (NBFCs). Hence, it is the normal course of business being done by the Bank. Read Less

Title: Qualified Institutional Placement
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that the sub-committee of the Board of Directors of the Bank (the "Bank" and Board the "Board of Directors") at its meeting held on March 11, 2011 determined March 11, 2011 to be the issue closing date and Rs. 604 per equity share to be the issue price pursuant to the qualified institutions placement of the equity shares under the provisions of Chapter VIII of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2009 ("SEBI ICDR Regulations") to certain eligible qualified institutional buyers as defined under 2(1)(zd) of the SEBI ICDR Regulations (the "Issue"). The sub-committee of the Board of Directors had also approved the placement document dated March 11, 2011 in respect of the Issue. The Bank vide its resolution dated March 15, 2011 passed by the sub-committee of the Board of Directors has confirmed the issue and allotment of 3,30,00,000 equity shares of face value of Rs. 10 each to raise aggregate proceeds of Rs. 1,993.20 crores. Consequently, the paid up capital of the Bank will be increased to Rs. 443 crores. The Government holdings continue to remain at Rs. 300 crores constituting 67.72% of the paid up capital of the Bank. Read Less

In tandem with the changing times, the Bank has embarked on a comprehensive branding exercise to unlock its value and realize the immense latent potential". The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here. Read Less

Title: Appointment
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that: "In exercise of the powers conferred by Sub-section 3(h) and (3-A) of section 9 of the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970/1980, read with the sub- clause (1) of clause 3 of the Nationalized Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Schemes, 1970/1980, the Central Govt., has nominated Shri Sunil Gupta and Dr. Yogendra Pati Tripathi as part-time non-official directors on the Board of Directors of Canara Bank for the period of three years from the date of notification or until further orders, whichever is earlier, vide notification No. F. No. 9/22/2006-BO-I dt. 23rd November 2007". Read Less

Title: Appointment
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that: "In exercise of the powers conferred by clause (a) of sub-section (3) of section 9 of the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970/1980, read with sub-clause (1) of clause 3, sub clause (1) of clause 8 of the Nationalised Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Scheme, 1970/1980, the Central Government, after consultation with the Reserve Bank of India, has appointed Shri G. S. Vedi, General Manager, Punjab and Sind Bank, as a whole time director (designated as the Executive Director) of Canara Bank from the date of his taking charge i.e from 07.11.2007 and until further orders or till the date of his superannuation i.e upto 30th June 2010, vide notification No. F.No.9/21/2006-BO-l dated 07th November 2007". Read Less

Title: Joint Venture
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated September 26, 2007 that: "The closing of the transaction in connection with J V with Robeco Groep N V, is scheduled to be held on 26.09.2007 at Mumbai. On the above date, Robeco Groep N V shall purchase the 49% agreed stake in CIMS from the Bank by paying the consideration agreed to between the parties". Read Less

Title: Acquisition of shares
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors have permitted the Bank to acquire differential shares so as to hold 51% stake in Can Fin Homes Ltd. in order to convert the sponsored entity into a subsidiary, through the process of open-offer. Necessary permissions have been obtained from RBI and Ministry of Finance. It has now been decided to release the Public Announcement on 27.08.2007 in connection with the acquisition. M/s Ind Bank Merchant Banking Services Limited, Chennai are the Merchant Bankers to the open-offer scheme". Read Less

Title: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Notice dated June 12, 2007, the Annual General Meeting of the Bank was held on July 26, 2007. As one of the items on the Agenda, the Election of Directors from amongst Shareholders other than the Central Government was held and the following candidates were declared elected. Sl.No. 1. Name- Shri Parampally Vasudeva Maiya. Sl No.2. Name- Shri Brij Behari Tandon. The aforesaid Shareholder Directors shall assume their office from July 27, 2007 and shall hold office till 26th July 2010 in terms of Clause 9 of Nationalised Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Scheme, 1970 read with the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970. Read Less

Title: Standalone Results Update, Quarter ended, 30-JUN-2007
Summary: CANARA BANK has informed the Exchange regarding the standalone Results for the quarter ended on 30-JUN-2007 as follows: Interest earned of Rs. 337997 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2007 against Rs. 251276 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2006. Interest expended of Rs. 248591 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2007 against Rs. 156493 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2006. Net Profit / (Loss) of Rs. 24055 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2007 against Rs. 19093 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2006. Read Less

Summary: Canara Bank has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the notice of the Annual General Meeting of the Shareholders of the Company to be held on July 26, 2007. A copy of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here. Read Less

Title: Book Closure
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that: "The Register of Shareholders and the Share transfer books of the Bank will remain closed from 28.06.2007 to 03.07.2007 (both days inclusive) in connection with: a) The 5th Annual General Meeting of the Bank, b) for the purpose of determining the shareholders entitled to receive the dividend, declared by the Bank, and c) for the purpose of determining the shareholders entitled to participate i.e. nominate, contest, and vote in the Election of Directors from amongst shareholders other than Government of India pursuant to Section 9(3)(i) of the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of undertaking) Act, 1970". Read Less

Title: Appointment
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that: "In exercise of the powers conferred by clause (a) of Sub-Section (3) of Section 9 of the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970/1980, read with sub-clause (1) of clause 3, sub-clause (1) of clause 8 of the Nationalized Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Scheme, 1970/1980, the Central Govt., after consultation with the Reserve Bank of India, has appointed Shri D.L.Rawal, General Manager, Punjab National Bank, as a whole time director (designated as the Executive Director) of Canara Bank from the date of his taking charge i.e. from 06.06.2007 and until further orders or till the date of his superannuation i.e. upto 31st October, 2011, vide notification No. F No. 9/21/2006-BO-1 dt. 06th June 2007". Read Less

Title: Change in Directorate
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that "Shri.Alok Kumar Misra, Executive Director of the Bank has been appointed as Chairman & Managing Director of Oriental Bank of Commerce by the Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Economic Affairs, Banking Division, vide its Notification No F NO 9/24/2005-BO I dt 4th June 2007. The Post of Executive Director of Canara bank has therefore fallen vacant on 05.06.2007". Read Less

Title: Dividend
Summary: Canara Bank has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors at its meetings held on May 02, 2007 has recommended a Dividend @ 70% for the year ended 31.03.2007. Read Less
